abstract: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is facing mounting outcry from members over new policy barring children living with same-sex couples from baby-naming ceremonies and baptisms, and declaring members in gay marriages to be apostates subject to excommunication; clarifications and rationale issued by church are finding little acceptance among critics, among them local church leaders.
lead_paragraph: A backlash is growing over rules that bar children of same-sex parents from baptisms and declares members in gay unions apostates subject to excommunication.

headline.main: New Policy on Gay Couples and Their Children Roils Mormon Church
headline.print_headline: New Rules on Gay Couples and Their Children Roil the Mormon Church
